title: College football bowl schedule for the 2019-20 season
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: USA TODAY Sports’ Paul Myerberg breaks down his college football offseason rankings USA TODAY

The college football bowl campaign puts a cap on the 2019 season. A total of 40 postseason games in the Football Bowl Subdivision are set to take place in December and January.

The action kicks off with the Bahamas Bowl and Frisco Bowl on Dec. 20. One day later, there are six games scheduled across the country.

The College Football Playoff semifinals will be held on Dec. 28 at the Fiesta Bowl in Glendale, Arizona and the Peach Bowl in Atlanta.

The national championship game will wrap up the bowl season extravaganza on Jan. 13 in New Orleans.

A rundown of all the games:

Dec. 20 — Bahamas Bowl: Conference USA vs. MAC, ESPN, 2 p.m.

Dec. 20 — Frisco Bowl: American vs. At-large, ESPN2, 7:30 p.m.

Dec. 21 — New Mexico Bowl: Conference USA vs. Mountain West, ESPN, 2 p.m.

Dec. 21 — Cure Bowl: American vs. Sun Belt, CBSSN, 2:30 p.m.

Dec. 21 — Boca Raton Bowl: American/Conference USA/MAC, ABC, 3:30 p.m.

Dec. 21 — Camellia Bowl: MAC vs. Sun Belt, ESPN, 5:30 p.m.

Dec. 21 — Las Vegas Bowl: Mountain West vs. Pac-12, ABC, 7:30 p.m.

Dec. 21 — New Orleans Bowl: Conference USA vs. Sun Belt, ESPN, 9 p.m.

Dec. 23 — Gasparilla Bowl: American vs. Conference USA, ESPN, 2:30 p.m.

Dec. 24 — Hawaii Bowl: BYU vs. American, ESPN, 8 p.m.

Dec. 26 — Independence Bowl: ACC/Notre Dame vs. SEC, ESPN, 4 p.m.

Dec. 26 — Quick Lane Bowl: ACC/Notre Dame vs. Big Ten, ESPN, 8 p.m.

Dec. 27 — Military Bowl: ACC/Notre Dame vs. American, ESPN, noon

Dec. 27 — Pinstripe Bowl: ACC/Notre Dame vs. Big Ten, ESPN, 3:20 p.m.

Dec. 27 — Texas Bowl: Big 12 vs. SEC, ESPN, 6:45 p.m.

Dec. 27 — Holiday Bowl: Big Ten vs. Pac-12, FS1, 8 p.m.

Dec. 27 — Cheez-It Bowl: Big 12 vs. Pac-12, ESPN, 10:15 p.m.

Dec. 28 — Camping World Bowl: ACC/Notre Dame vs. Big 12, ABC, noon

Dec. 28 — Cotton Bowl: At-large vs. At-large, ESPN, noon

Dec. 28 — Fiesta Bowl: College Football Playoff semifinal, ESPN, 4 or 8 p.m.

Dec. 28 — Peach Bowl: College Football Playoff semifinal, ESPN, 4 or 8 p.m.

Dec. 30 — First Responder Bowl: Big Ten vs. Conference USA, ESPN, 12:30 p.m.

Dec. 30 — Redbox Bowl: Big Ten vs. Pac-12, Fox, 4 p.m.

Dec. 30 — Music City Bowl: ACC/Big Ten/Notre Dame vs. SEC, ESPN, 4 p.m.

Dec. 30 — Orange Bowl: ACC vs. Big Ten/SEC/Notre Dame, ESPN, 8 p.m.

Dec. 31 — Belk Bowl: ACC/Notre Dame vs. SEC, ESPN, noon

Dec. 31 — Sun Bowl: ACC/Notre Dame vs. Pac-12, CBS, 2 p.m.

Dec. 31 — Liberty Bowl: Big 12 vs. SEC, ESPN, 3:45 p.m.

Dec. 31 — Arizona Bowl: Mountain West vs. Sun Belt, CBSSN, 4:30 p.m.

Dec. 31 — Alamo Bowl: Big 12 vs. Pac-12, ESPN, 7:30 p.m.

Jan. 1 — Citrus Bowl: ACC/Notre Dame/Big Ten vs. SEC, ABC, 1 p.m.

Jan. 1 — Outback Bowl: Big Ten vs. SEC, ESPN, 1 p.m.

Jan. 1 — Rose Bowl: Big Ten vs. Pac-12, ESPN, 5 p.m.

Jan. 1 — Sugar Bowl: Big 12 vs. SEC, ESPN, 8:45 p.m.

Jan. 2 — Birmingham Bowl: American vs. SEC, ESPN, 3 p.m.

Jan. 2 — Gator Bowl: ACC/Notre Dame/Big Ten vs. SEC, ESPN, 7 p.m.

Jan. 3 — Idaho Potato Bowl: MAC vs. Mountain West, ESPN, 3:30 p.m.

Jan. 4 — Armed Forces Bowl: Big Ten vs. Mountain West, ESPN, 11:30 a.m.

Jan. 6 — Mobile Bowl: MAC vs. Sun Belt, ESPN, 7:30 p.m.

Jan. 13 — College Football Playoff title game: Semifinal winners, ESPN, 8 p.m.
description: 40 postseason games in the Bowl Subdivision will be played in December and January to end the college football season. A look at the bowl schedule.
